reviews.text: The place is so amazing, after trekking through big boulder sections, you get this such a wide plain area with multiple water streams running, multiple small waterfalls/streams and a small Beas Kund. And the huge snow covered peaks all around. Even after reaching the area, you will have to locate the kund, because it is not visible.
Best trek near manali,trek start from dhundi ahead of solang valley,awsome place nice weather,2 days trek from dhundi to beas kund.
Awesome place for tracking love the track and the valleys that comes between this track nice view of hanuman tibba
Heaven on earth😍
Beautiful place. The origin of the river beas.

There are a very few places I'd give five stars rating for but this has to be one of them and not just because of the fact that it's inside a park hidden among tall euclidean trees . But the mystery of the structure is what fascinates me . Animal sacrifices were a common religious thing in the past but this temple takes it to another level. In a place this ancient I'm absolutely positive that there was something supernatural going on there . And the best part about all of it is that you can also still feel the same once you're there

Great natural beauty. This temple is under the thick cover of forest and mountains. Around this temple wherever you will see then only mountains and trees will be visible.
And also it is the great place for worshipping and relieving our stressed mind. The air is so pure and awesome nature. Here i visited on my school trip in November and there was rain. We enjoyed on our full potential and collected memories in bulk. I will never forget this part of my life.....
😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍

The place is situated between the mountains and is really beautiful! It is made up of woods and is surrounded by so many trees! You can sit and enjoy the beauty of nature. The place is worth visiting. There are so many activities that can be done outside the temple like yak riding, photo with rabbit, etc. A very peaceful and photogenic place. You can take beautiful pictures and relax over there.

The place is situated between the mountains and is really beautiful! It is made up of woods and is surrounded by so many trees! You can sit and enjoy the beauty of nature. 
The place is worth visiting. There are so many activities that can be done outside the temple like yak riding, photo with rabbit, etc. A very peaceful and photogenic place. 
You can take beautiful pictures and relax over there.
Good place and a very unique temple in itself as it worships a demon.

This place with it's tall trees and beautiful surroundings has a calming effect on you. It's a historic place and really gives out the feel. Though it's a bit away from the hustle and bustle of the city and takes a while to get there but it's worth it in the end. A problem here is getting a ride back after it gets dark. So I'll recommend you to book a ride beforehand.

As the name suggests, it's a museum of Himachal's cultural and folk history..The museum consists of old farming techniques, excavated tools, kitchen utensils, traditional clothes and sandals, scale models of houses and temples, full scale model of old Himachal style kitchen..Video and audio guides are available as per request...

The museum is less noticeable from road and won't  feel like a govt. Operated tourist spot at first  glimpse..due to this the place is very less crowded..

Ticket rate : RS 10/ head

Must visit place the getting to know the culture of the people in Himachal. The place is very near to the Hadimba Mata Temple.

All the artifacts are not very well maintained though. Some leather work has got fungus. 1 or 2 artifacts have fallen down from their glass support.

Very very very good and brilliant ideas presentation of Himachal Pradesh art and culture  here.
We went  to see the museum yesterday with my friends from Hyderabad . they are really interested and fully satisfied.

I wish the government had maintained the museum with more lights and some more things. My trip to the museum ended in 15mins. A guide would be a nice idea who relates the things and add few more stories to structures put inside. Maybe a folk dance outside would add focus to place. or some ethnic work being done can be live streamed.
Place shows the old himachali culture, max one can spend 15 mins here. If u r visiting Hidimba temple u can visit this place.

This one of the wonderful  visiting  spot on the way  from  manali  to  rohtang  pass. It is nearly  28 km away from manali. Water  from the ghats will  mesmerised us. First touch of the water  will thrille us. We can see the buety  of himalayas. During the winter  we have to take care about clothing.  Definitely  we have to wear  sweaters  and monkey cap. From manali  we can reach here by bus (manali rohthang  or manali kelong  or manali leh) or by taxi.
Great place for a romantic drive! Love the weather
The road is nice but ride with more careful
It's awesome place really amazing
Natural beauty point in the way to Rohtang from Manali. View point is just tremendous. Waterfall can be viewed from road which is  ittle far away from Waterfall.

This one of the wonderful  visiting  spot on the way  from  manali  to  rohtang  pass. It is nearly  28 km away from manali. Water  from the ghats will  mesmerised us. First touch of the water  will thrille us. We can see the buety  of himalayas. During the winter  we have to take care about clothing.  Definitely  we have to wear  sweaters  and monkey cap. From manali  we can reach here by bus (manali rohthang  or manali kelong  or manali leh) or by taxi.
Great place for a romantic drive! Love the weather
The road is nice but ride with more careful
It's awesome place really amazing
Natural beauty point in the way to Rohtang from Manali. View point is just tremendous. Waterfall can be viewed from road which is  ittle far away from Waterfall.
Best view that you can get in Manali! Peace, nature and just serene beauty. Ample space for the kids to run around. Very hospitable staff and personal attention.  Good restaurants around.
Love this place. Independent and royal feel
one of the Most beautiful huts or say hotel  I have ever been to.

Superb heritage and traditional  location of log huts Manali is really commanding.
VVIP'S special arrangements available here.
Lot of unique and awesome location and fine attraction for tourists and travel partners.
But a lovely location.
I really feel here like heaven.
Staff too supporting and tourist friendly.
Good luck ahead
Hem Raj Sharma tourism officer retd

One of the best places to stay. 
Independent huts. Well furnished. You can cook your own food. 
Nice friendly staff. Overall a great place to stay.

This one of the wonderful  visiting  spot on the way  from  manali  to  rohtang  pass. It is nearly  28 km away from manali. Water  from the ghats will  mesmerised us. First touch of the water  will thrille us. We can see the buety  of himalayas. During the winter  we have to take care about clothing.  Definitely  we have to wear  sweaters  and monkey cap. From manali  we can reach here by bus (manali rohthang  or manali kelong  or manali leh) or by taxi.
Great place for a romantic drive! Love the weather
The road is nice but ride with more careful
It's awesome place really amazing
Natural beauty point in the way to Rohtang from Manali. View point is just tremendous. Waterfall can be viewed from road which is  ittle far away from Waterfall.
Lovely place to visit..... Beautiful scenic view.... yak ride...Many more adventure sports...And not to forget a beautiful bridge too.

Nehru Kund was a small patch of ice in a beautiful setting. Since we could not go to Solang because of heavy snowfall, this was the next best. Had a wonderful time skiing, sliding on a tube and even going on a makeshift sled. With snow/ice all around and the river flowing through it, I am glad we went there
Wow! Such a lovely place ! Divine and breathtakingly beautiful.  The hot water springs is an attraction. Must visit.
Wow! Such a lovely place ! Divine and breathtakingly beautiful.  The hot water springs is an attraction. Must visit.
it's a beautiful place to visit and if you're a nature lover you must go! it's fun and clean you can say hygienic
Good prices
Good food good mood
Good food , good people and great river side seating . What more can one ask for?
My favourite café in old Manali! The food is incredible and it's cheaper than the other cafés.
Nice
Over priced. Better cafes available all over the place. Be prepared for poor service if you are Indian.

Chic and cozy interiors amidst woods makes this a great place for a quiet and relaxed dining experience. The food is something worth going for, albeit a little pricey. It was one of the few vegetarian restaurants (although this place also serves egg) in Manali that served great Italian/ Spanish food. Service is great but it took a good 20-25 mins for our food to be served. They also serve beer and wine. Would definitely recommend a visit here.
NIce view! Good food (though i must say with limited options only).
Nice good food hotel is good location

Menu is OVERPRICED! Food is not upto the mark of the marked up price. The property is beautiful but the manager is Rude & increases the price of the rooms at will. 
Since the manager gave us the room for ₹2500 he excluded breakfast at will. Though their listing includes breakfast.Very unprofessional behaviour from the manager. 
We booked their rooms for 3 days. But every morning he kept coming to our room and said I will have to check for the availability of the room. This was absurd since we already had booked it. We went in December which is an off season for tourists but he kept denying it while everyone else said the same. 
They failed to give tv connection in the room. 
Overall other than the unprofessional service level the stay wasn’t bad.

Great luxurious place.good architecture.
Nice views all around (mountains). The road outside sometimes has bit of traffic but once you go inside you forget it all.
Nice place to spend some quality time. The things we ordered took some time to be served on table but taste was excellent.
And great place to capture some memories (pictures) both inside the cafe and outside.

We visited Johnson's cafe for lunch. It is ranked no 2 in trip advisor in terms of restaurants. It is a beautiful place to eat, having outside seating and the interiors are very good.  The Johnson hotel is very old and was established during the British era. No doubt it is thronged by foreigners. We ordered garlic bread, pizza, hot chocolate and pasta. The hot chocolate was divine, again me and my sis had all our eyes for it.at the last gulp my sis had to say Didi will you drink it all!!  The pasta and pizza were in tune with the weather outside.it is must must visit for the enticing your taste buds.
With a sprawling lawn overlooking the snow capped peaks, Johnson's serves lip smacking food and beverages. Try their delicious waffles while bathing in the sun with a book. It will be a good day

If you want to soak in the feeling of being in Manali with some nice cocktails, pizza and great ambience, then The Johnson's Cafe is where you should be. This cafe overlooks the scenic beauty and chilly mountains of Manali giving it an amazing aura. The decor is colourful and peppy which adds to the character of this cafe. As far as the food is concerned, you won't be disappointed. They serve some really nice freshly baked pizza. The cocktails are just amazing, especially the ones with cinnamon in it. You can also sit by the bonfire and enjoy your meals during chilly nights. Really an inviting place.

It is a trendy place in Manali which comprises of a three star hotel and a continental restaurant. I have not stayed in their accommodations but have been a guest at their restaurant a number of times. The restaurant has two sections, two separate sitting areas, and both of them are an open design with lots of space, light and air. Their signature dishes are the locally caught river trouts prepared in a variety of styles ranging from baked trout with mashed potatoes to trout in curry south Indian style to grilled trout with a side dish of seasonal local veggies. In fact they have a whole section (almost half of the contents) of the menu dedicated to various preparations of fresh river trouts. To be honest I have not tried any of their other dishes because their trout dishes are what I needed to savour whenever in Manali. Theirs are the best river trout preparations I have ever had the good fortune of treating my taste buds to. But one should be careful in choosing the trout dishes to order because with their wide variety of preparations not every one of them would be liked by all. So the best thing to do if you are undecided is to take help of the gentlemen who wait at the tables. Give them a brief about the kind of river trout dish you would like to have or let them guide you through the preparations and their ingredients and they will help you choose the ones which you would most likely love to have. And as all the trout dishes are prepared fresh on order you may have to wait a minimum of 30 minutes for them to be served.

Best Chinese cuisine ever tasted in Abuja. the ambience is so lovely and family friendly. So convenient to take the kids for a good meal. The only reservation I have is that there's no wheel chair or stroller access.

Chopsticks is a good restaurants. Where u can eat good food... Such as Beef sauce, Chicken sauce, prawn's sauce, sweet and Sawer's sauce and also Fish and the sauce also...With a good Hall for your meetings and occasions..... The atmospheres is good and peaceful... The service are good and wonderful...

Chopsticks has to be one if the best Chinese restaurants in Abuja. I have know this place for almost 10years now and they are still amazing. Their rice in chicken,beef or egg is so nicely made that you could be tempted to eat it without any sauce. The sauce is so nice and large in quantity that a bowl can serve up 3 people. The only issue I have with this place is that they don not have enough parking space to accommodate quite a number if cars. Asides that, all the dishes are amazing!!!
For a special date it's great. Serene interior, very polite staff and most importantly great food. Good when you're not in a hurry, maybe after a nice swim or massage...can't find Smiley's!

Food taste good. Nice environment for kids too and great for family gatherings or small events like birthdays. Portions of food are big and typically goes round people with extra to take home. Waiter are also polite and pay attention to good customer service.

A very relaxed place, just like the city should be. By virtue of being away from the main town square, you'll find this place isn't as busy (the irony that this epitome of relaxation is the centre of tourism) as the rest of the cafes.

The service is exceptional and the food is delicious. The owners are very liberal and you can stay for hours, relaxing and playing board games. I would definitely recommend the place for large groups.

This cafe in located in old Manali and is on the back side of house of Amigos hostel.  It also has low sitting area which is quite comfortable. Ginger lemon honey tea is really good and so is the Pizza. Service can be improved upon Overall a good experience and would visit again for the food .

Mouth water Food 🥘 with Cozy Ambience  and lot of variety to order. If its raining & cold Drifters’s has the fire place was giving us the right comfort. good food, good choiceStaff is very helping too..

Amazing place. Must visit if you're in Manali. Minced lamb burger is a hot hit. Don't forget to add caramalized onion and yak cheese. Pasta is way too amazing. Pizzas are heavily delicious. All in all, nothing disappoints. Perfect place.

Thank you guys so much for all the help, for being so kind and friendly! Gaaaautam! U are the best host and we are gonna miss u for sure! Thanks for all the good experiences and for being such a good friend. Hope to see u guys veeery soon!
This cafe is famous for momos and veg pizzas...This is vegetarian cafe... all Items are freshly made and served... My little one loves this cafe's Pizza
Awesome thukpa soup must try here it you are in Manali

I visited this place twice. First time every thing was good. Second time experience was worst. Fried Momos which i ordered was full of oil when i asked them to replace they refused to do that. Was the worst exp

Must visit if you come to Manali 
Should try cheese momo and veg chowmein

Go there if you have all the time in the world, one order of fried momos took more than half an hour. My face looked like a momo by the time my order came cause they forgot the "Only" dish we ordered and if you like clean tables you might have ask more than once for the same.

Great luxurious place.good architecture.
Nice views all around (mountains). The road outside sometimes has bit of traffic but once you go inside you forget it all.
Nice place to spend some quality time. The things we ordered took some time to be served on table but taste was excellent.
And great place to capture some memories (pictures) both inside the cafe and outside.

The Johnson hotel is very old and was established during the British era. No doubt it is thronged by foreigners. We ordered garlic bread, pizza, hot chocolate and pasta. The hot chocolate was divine, again me and my sis had all our eyes for it.at the last gulp my sis had to say Didi will you drink it all!!  The pasta and pizza were in tune with the weather outside.it is must must visit for the enticing your taste buds.
With a sprawling lawn overlooking the snow capped peaks, Johnson's serves lip smacking food and beverages. Try their delicious waffles while bathing in the sun with a book. It will be a good day

In fact they have a whole section (almost half of the contents) of the menu dedicated to various preparations of fresh river trouts. To be honest I have not tried any of their other dishes because their trout dishes are what I needed to savour whenever in Manali. Theirs are the best river trout preparations I have ever had the good fortune of treating my taste buds to. But one should be careful in choosing the trout dishes to order because with their wide variety of preparations not every one of them would be liked by all. So the best thing to do if you are undecided is to take help of the gentlemen who wait at the tables. Give them a brief about the kind of river trout dish you would like to have or let them guide you through the preparations and their ingredients and they will help you choose the ones which you would most likely love to have. And as all the trout dishes are prepared fresh on order you may have to wait a minimum of 30 minutes for them to be served.

Good place with good location.. Outside sitting is just fabulous. Food is expensive taking under consideration that its a hill station and you can find better food at cheaper rate. Quantity is less and rates are high. Good for one time visit but view from this restaurant is worth and one can feels happy while sitting there. . .
Indoor seating is quite cozy with warm lights. The outdoor river facing view has its own charm in morning. Had evening snacks over there. Food was great.

Definitely the talk-of-the-town as we walked long distance to reach here based on word of mouth to spend our first evening in Manali. The complete setup is enticing. Each and everything so perfectly thought over to make the place worth living. River flowing by the side. Live music is the main virtue let alone the drinks and food.

My second favourite place to eat in Manali. 

Few of its dishes are a blast of flavours in your mouth. 

The sitting is decent
It has some great views. 
Service can be slightly improved

But food takes everything over here 😍
Super cozy restaurant. Enjoyed watching the snow and river from here. Must try their chocolate lava cake.

Butter croissant and waffles are must.
You can take a seat in and enjoy the environment.
There's not much to gaze upon but food and ambience is calm & cool due to outsiders as moon dance cafe itself is a recommended chain.
They have some amazing food and coffee. The staff is really very kind and generous to guide you through. Great place to enjoy your coffee while waiting for the bus.

Good food. We ordered Israeli breakfast which was amazing. The view from here is also good. Nutella pan cake is the best out here.

Can improve upon the service though.
The place was really good. It's a great stop for out of town tourists. It has great options for baked food and crepes.
Good food at decent rates. The service was also faster than the other cafes in Kasol. The Israeli dishes were nice. The burger was a letdown though

A great place to eat with lovely people and yummilicious food.. the owners are very warm hearted .. beautiful scenery around.. feels like situated in the heart of a beautiful nature picture.. beautifully constructed.. washrooms are also very hygienic...

To be honest this is the freshest place to have your food. They have a kitchen that is very much vosible from the sitting area and you can see them cook too.

Moreover we were a group of 2 and what an amazing food  they served us in no time. Loved the view from the balcony too. 

Everything is top notch about this place.
This is the place I always go when ever I visit Manali. The kath-khuni style cottage is an inspiration. Great view and humble owner. Highly recommended for a pizza.
Everything is Awesome..Food, Location,  Restaurant and the Owner.. Just Loved It.. Highly Recommended.
Ambience: excellent. View: awesome. Food: very good. Chef/owner: warm

The restaurant is not in the best position to attract customers, but has beautiful, delicious and authentic Indian food. The service was very uplifting and friendly which complimented well with their flavoursome dishes we ordered. 
Overall my family and I were very impressed and satisfied with the food and service the restaurant had to offer. I would highly recommend them to locals and tourists.

Stopped in while on a day trip to Innsbruck and was so glad I did! Quaint family-run restaurant who were eager to please with some of the best Indian food I've ever had.
As a group we got several lamb dishes that were nothing short of excellent. You could cut the lamb with a spoon it was so tender!
If you're in Innsbruck and craving great Indian food I couldn't recommend a better spot!

I stopped at the restaurant a few years ago during a tour of Europe. 
 Welcoming atmosphere. Staff is very warm and friendly. Food is quite good for the price. Overall, worth the visit. Do stop by if in Innsbruck.
Food is the worst. Felt sick for days after eating my lunch from here. Staff were extremely ride

I wish I could give this rating in negative. Such a horrible experience. Unhealthy, unhygienic, tasteless & stale food. This restaurant should be closed right away. The owner and his wife ( I think) were so rude. I was asked to take my baby out until the food is ready just because she was playing around. They don’t accept card, doing business illegal. No proper invoice was given. We didn’t eat any of the dishes. DONT VISIT THIS RESTAURANT. GUYS BEWARE!!!

Real valley view cafe
Awesome place
Cool
